title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 2B.51 - Pedestrian Crossing Signs (R9-2, R9-3)
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 2B.51 - Pedestrian Crossing Signs (R9-2, R9-3)

State Regulations
DELETE Paragraph 05; the R9-3a sign shall not be used in

New York. INSERT the following paragraph: Option: 04A The USE CROSSWALK (R9-3bP), USE UNDERPASS (NYR6-5P), and USE OVERPASS (NYR6-7P) supplemental plaques (see Figure 2B-26 and Sign

Drawing SD-R10) may be installed below the R9-3sign to indicate the direction
to a nearby crosswalk, underpass, or overpass. A left-facing arrow, placed to
the left of the word "USE," may be used, as needed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
2B.51

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
